Description: At top 40 guitarsour customers satisfaction is our first concern.All of out items have a 14 day return policy.If after 14 days you are not completely satisfiedwith your purchase, please return it for a full refund....Peace be with you... *all returned items must be in the same condition theywere at the time of sale. All original packing must be included. # Up for Sale is aVintage 1979 Electra MPC X320! Transparent Red Single Cut! This is really cool. You are looking at a Vintage 1979 Electra MPC X320. This is a very unusual Guitar. It is a Modular Powered Circuit. These are hard plastic module cartridges that snap into the back of the guitar. They are powered by a 9 volt battery. There are several different modules available for this guitar. This X320 is equipped with a phase shifter and a power overdrive. You just flip the toggle switch to on and control it with the bottom knobs. The Electra guitars were built by Matsumoku of Japan. Matsumoku was the Top guitar builder in Japan in the 1970's to early 1980's. They built a lot of the "Lawsuit Guitars" most notably Ibanez.Peter Frampton and Rick Derringer were 2 of the notable users and endorsers of the Electra brand. Beautiful Transparent Red with Gold Hardware. 5-way rotary switch. Pink / Green abalone fret markers. Binding. Dual Humbuckers. Great Playing and Sounding guitar. Our luthier did a complete setup. Frets are in great shape. Neck is Straight. Brand new strings were installed. Gig ready on Arrival! Serial Number: #27012 Nut Width: 1.65" Weight: 9.45 lbs. Case is NOT Included Cosmetics: Good Condition. Keep in mind that this is a nearly 40 year old vintage guitar that has been used. The Top is pretty clean. There are some light strumming scratches on the pickguard as well as on the top itself, A few small chips and dings on the Top. The back has some belt buckle rash scratches from being held next to the player's body. There are numerous small pencil point dings on the back. There is some binding missing at the top of the headstock. (See picture #7). Neck and Fretboard are in fine condition. Pristine. Dripping with "Mojo" It is used. Not perfect. Look at the pictures closely. They will tell the story. We are here to help! Top 40 guitars is a Veteran owned business.
